Just another reminder that Yale Public Schools will continue its food giveaway for its students in need each Wednesday from 5 pm - 6 pm through the remainder of the school year. The pick up is located in the "loop" at the back entrance of Yale Elementary School. For those individuals who have not previously participated in the food giveaways and plan on coming, please text us at 810 304-2200 and include full names of your children so we may appropriate plan for expected numbers of students. If you have already attended previous giveaways, we have included your family on the list so it is not necessary to reach out to us at this time. We truly appreciate the ongoing patience and demonstrated support that we have received for our district from parents and the community at large.

Please share this post with those families of our students who you believe are in need and struggling during these times. We have been able to reach approximately 300 families each week through these efforts and want to make certain that we are serving our students and their families as best we can.

shared_text:
Yale High
January 27 at 12:56 PM ·

Last week, Seniors completed the Poetry Out Loud competition sponsored by the
Michigan Humanities Council.
Jodi Protasciewicz is the winner, chosen among 27 seniors
Mr. Bearss, Mrs. Peltier, and former school champion Tressa Garcia
judged the contest.

She recited "Common Dust" by Georgia Douglas Johnston found below.

She will head to Lansing on March 13 for a statewide competition.

Common Dust
BY GEORGIA DOUGLAS JOHNSON
And who shall separate the dust
What later we shall be:
Whose keen discerning eye will scan
And solve the mystery?

The high, the low, the rich, the poor,
The black, the white, the red,
And all the chromatique between,
Of whom shall it be said:

Here lies the dust of Africa;
Here are the sons of Rome;
Here lies the one unlabelled,
The world at large his home!

Can one then separate the dust?
Will mankind lie apart,
When life has settled back again
The same as from the start?

CONGRATULATIONS, Jodi!
